Note the duration of the seizure and any unusual symptoms, and call for emergency medical services if the seizure lasts longer than five minutes or if the person is injured, pregnant, or diabetic. After the seizure, stay with the person and offer reassurance and support until they fully recover.

question: How to give CPR??
answer: 1)For an adult or child, place the heel of one hand on the center of the chest at the nipple line. You can also push with one hand on top of the other.
